title: S&P; Global (SPGI) Q3 2023 Earnings Call Transcript - The Motley Fool
summary: S&P Global's Q3 2023 earnings call highlighted strong revenue growth across divisions, driven by innovation, particularly in sustainability and energy transition products. The company reported a 22% year-over-year increase in Vitality Index revenue, which reflects revenue from new or enhanced products. Additional product launches included platforms integrating capabilities from both Platts and IHS Connect, demonstrating cross-divisional collaboration. Despite external economic uncertainties, S&P Global remains optimistic about long-term growth thanks to sustained demand for its offerings in private markets and sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the company is focusing on sustainability and energy transition products which contribute to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the article discusses new or enhanced products and business processes that significantly differ from S&P Global's previous offerings and have been introduced to the market.
green_product: TRUE, because S&P Global is improving products related to sustainability and providing solutions that help companies with their sustainability strategies, thus reducing environmental impact.
green_process: FALSE, because while the call mentions the development and launch of new products related to sustainability, it does not explicitly discuss a process or method that minimizes environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services, 541519 - Other Computer Related Services, 541612 - Human Resources Consulting Services, 511210 - Software Publishers
greenwashing: FALSE, as the company's statements and actions support sustainable practices and genuine improvements in their product offerings rather than misleading claims.
